item.description:
Update

I now know the movie time - we are going to the 7:45 show. I will be at the theater by 7. We will go into the theater to get seats by 7:25. I've lost my meetup hat again, so I'll wear my red hoody. If the movie is upstairs, I'll be waiting by the tables by the big window in the second floor lobby, and if it's downstairs I'll be behind the ropes across from the refreshment stand.

 

Details  

 

 

I strongly encourage folks to buy tickets ahead of time at fandango.com.

If you miss the group before the movie, no worries, you can meet us after. We gather outside the doors of the room showing the movie afterwards. Then we head out for some munchies and drinkies.

Please excuse my reckless font-changing meetup.com has once again changed things and I don't quite know how to work the new editor.

Synopsis

Irresponsible charmer Arthur Bach (Russell Brand) has always relied on two things to get by: his limitless fortune and the good sense of lifelong nanny Hobson (Helen Mirren) to keep him out of trouble. Now he faces his biggest challenge--choosing between an arranged marriage that will ensure his lavish lifestyle or an uncertain future with the one thing money can't buy, Naomi (Greta Gerwig), the only woman he has ever loved. With Naomi's inspiration and some unconventional help from Hobson, Arthur will take the most expensive risk of his life and finally learn what it means to become a man, in this re-imagining of the classic romantic comedy "Arthur."
 

Trailers and more information at Arthurthemovie.com.

item.why: Well, I liked the original Arthur oh so many years ago with Dudley Moore and John Gielgud, and Russel Brand and Helen Mirren are taking those roles and were a hoot in the last couple of films I saw them in, so, hey worth a shot!
